page.title: 02Pencombe St.John's Church.
page.content: The present church was built over the ruins of an early Norman church,one hundred and twenty years ago. The current vicar is the {Rev.C.Harper.}The church wardens are, {Major Mercer-Wilson and Mr. T. Davies. Regular services are held on Sundays, together with services for religious events. Marriages,baptisms,confirmations and funerals are also conducted. Presently the average congregation, on a sunday, is around fifteen.This being usually much larger however during special religious festivals. The bells in the tower ring loudly to tell people that a service,or a function, is on its way.The churchyard is now closed and people are being buried in a cemetery,a half kilometre away.
